messages.message: Palestinian communications company Paltel: Internet services in the northern Gaza Strip and Gaza City have been shut down due to "Israeli aggression".
Palestinian communications company Paltel: Internet services in the northern Gaza Strip and Gaza City are down due to "Israeli aggression".
Al Jazeera from senior Hamas official Osama Hamdan: The mediators did not inform us about the resumption of talks.
Al Jazeera from senior Hamas official Osama Hamdan: The mediators did not inform us anything about the resumption of talks.
The Lebanese Al-Mayadeen channel from a source in Hamas: they deny the Israeli announcement about a return to negotiations this coming Tuesday.
The Lebanese Al-Mayadeen channel from a source in Hamas: they deny the Israeli announcement about a return to negotiations this coming Tuesday.
Lebanese sources: An Israeli shell hit a fuel tank near Al-Khiam prison in southern Lebanon. A large fire broke out on site.
Lebanese sources: An Israeli shell hit a fuel tank near the Khiam prison in southern Lebanon. A big fire broke out there.

They also filed another lawsuit against Daniel Defense, which manufactured the AR-style rifle used in the May 24, 2022, shooting — and has already been sued.
“There is a direct line between the conduct of these companies and the Uvalde shooting,” said Josh Koskoff, an attorney for the families.
The lawsuit against Georgia-based gun-maker Daniel Defense was filed in Texas by the same group of 19 families who sued on Wednesday.
Daniel Defense and Meta each did not immediately respond to emails requesting comment.

Authorities have evacuated more than 11,000 people from the Kharkiv region since Russia launched an offensive there on May 10, regional Gov.
Russian President Vladimir Putin has said the Kremlin’s army is attempting to create a “buffer zone” in the Kharkiv region to prevent Ukrainian cross-border attacks.
The new Russian offensive is stretching thin Ukraine’s depleted ranks, exhausted by more than two years of war.
Thursday’s strike on Kharkiv using S-300 missiles hit a printing company, burning about 50,000 books, Zelenskyy said.

Damascus’ Mazze neighborhood houses the Iranian consulate, destroyed last month in a strike blamed on Israel.
State news agency, SANA, didn’t say who the person killed was but said the blast set two other cars ablaze.
The Beirut-based Al-Mayadeen TV didn’t say if there were casualties, but the Observatory said two Hezbollah members were killed and several others wounded in the drone strike.
Iran’s military presence in Syria has been a major concern for Israel, which has vowed to stop Iranian entrenchment along its northern border.
Israel responded with a retaliatory war that has killed more than 35,000 Palestinians, many of them women and children, according to Gaza health officials.

Russian jamming has rendered US-supplied HIMARS rocket launchers "completely ineffective."
US-supplied HIMARS rocket launchers have been rendered "completely ineffective" as a result of Russian electronic jamming systems, a new report said.
According to the assessment, Russian jamming can cause the missiles to miss a target by 50 feet or more.
Earlier this week, a report revealed that US-supplied glide bombs were also continually missing their targets as a result of Russian jamming.
The Russian jamming system operates from the ground, projecting a "cone" that prevents weapons from communicating with satellites.

KYIV – Ukrainian forces have secured “combat control” of areas where Russian troops entered the northeastern Kharkiv region earlier this month, President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said.
Recommended VideosKharkiv is about 20 kilometers (12 miles) from the Russian border.
Vovchansk has been a flashpoint for fighting since Russia launched the offensive in the Kharkiv region.
Russian President Vladimir Putin has said the Kremlin’s army is attempting to create a “buffer zone” in the Kharkiv region to prevent Ukrainian cross-border attacks.
In addition to the ground offensive operation along Ukraine's northeastern border, Russia is continuing to bombard the Kharkiv region with missiles, guided aerial bombs and drones.

The International Court of Justice, or World Court, has no means to enforce its emergency ruling in case brought by South Africa accusing Israel of genocide.
More than 35,000 Palestinians have been killed in Israel's offensive in Gaza, Gaza's health ministry says.
A total of 31 Palestinians were killed in the past day in the Gaza Strip, according to local medical officials.
The Israeli military said its troops in Jabalia "eliminated dozens of terrorists in close-quarters combat and aerial strikes."
Israel has said it is carrying out operations in Rafah, despite growing international opposition, to remove Hamas battalions holed up there.

Spain's Minister of Defence Margarita Robles.
— Photo: AFP filePublished: Sat 25 May 2024, 8:09 PM Last updated: Sat 25 May 2024, 8:10 PMThe Spanish defence minister said on Saturday that the conflict in Gaza is a "real genocide", as relations between Israel and Spain worsen following Madrid's decision to recognise a Palestinian state.
The remark by Spanish Defence Minister Margarita Robles in an interview with TVE state television echoed a comment by Spanish Deputy Prime Minister Yolanda Diaz who earlier this week also described the Gaza conflict as a genocide.
"We cannot ignore what is happening in Gaza, which is a real genocide," Robles said in the interview, during which she also discussed the Russian-Ukraine tension and conflicts in Africa.
"This is not against anyone, this is not against the Israeli state, this is not against the Israelis, who are people we respect," she said.

Spanish Defense Minister Margarita Robles attends a meeting during a NATO summit in Madrid, Spain, on June 29, 2022.
(Yves Herman/Reuters)MADRID — The Spanish defense minister said on Saturday that the conflict in Gaza is a “real genocide”, as relations between Israel and Spain worsen following Madrid’s decision to recognize a Palestinian state.
The remark by Spanish Defence Minister Margarita Robles in an interview with TVE state television echoed a comment by Spanish Deputy Prime Minister Yolanda Diaz who earlier this week also described the Gaza conflict as a genocide.
“We cannot ignore what is happening in Gaza, which is a real genocide,” Robles said in the interview, during which she also discussed the Russian invasion of Ukraine and conflicts in Africa.
“This is not against anyone, this is not against the Israeli state, this is not against the Israelis, who are people we respect,” she said.

At precisely the same time Mr Khan made his announcement regarding Israel, he also said he intends to secure warrants for the leaders of the Hamas terrorist group.
World leaders were quick in their condemnation of this manifestly unhelpful decision and the UK was right to join the criticism.
On the contrary, Israel has made extensive efforts to facilitate humanitarian aid to Gaza’s civilian population, totalling more than 550,000 tonnes since October 7.
Hamas’s deliberate strategy of embedding itself within urban areas means that civilians will be killed and civilian infrastructure destroyed.
Lawfare and the politicisation of armed conflict puts our own Armed Forces at great risk.

World leaders were quick in their condemnation of this manifestly unhelpful decision and the UK was right to join the criticism.
No impartial observer could reasonably conclude that Israeli leaders are committing such heinous crimes.
On the contrary, Israel has made extensive efforts to facilitate humanitarian aid to Gaza’s civilian population, totalling more than 550,000 tonnes since October 7.
Hamas’s deliberate strategy of embedding itself within urban areas means that civilians will be killed and civilian infrastructure destroyed.
Lawfare and the politicisation of armed conflict puts our own Armed Forces at great risk.

Skip next section Death toll in DIY store strike rises to 6, local officials say05/26/2024 May 26, 2024 Death toll in DIY store strike rises to 6, local officials sayRussian strikes on a crowded DIY hardware store in Kharkiv on Saturday killed at least six people and injured dozens, the region’s Governor Oleh Syniehubov said on national television.
Forty people were injured, with at least three in serious condition.
Kharkiv Mayor Ihor Terekhov said about 120 people had been in the hardware store when the bombs struck.
"The attack targeted the shopping center, where there were many people — this is clearly terrorism," Terekhov said.
The past week has seen an uptick in strikes on the city after Russian troops stormed across the border, opening a new front north of the city.

The past week has seen an uptick in strikes on the city after Russian troops stormed across the border, opening a new front north of the city.

messages.message:
Kharkiv regional governor Oleg Synegubov said on Telegram that six people "died on the spot", 40 were wounded and 16 missing after two guided Russian bombs hit the store.
- 'Brutal blow' -Later Saturday, another strike hit the centre of Kharkiv, wounding 14 in an area containing a post office, a hairdresser and a cafe, the city's mayor Igor Terekhov said.
The latest attacks came after Russia launched a ground offensive in the Kharkiv region on May 10.
- Border strikes -Russia and Ukraine accused each others' forces of attacks in the border area Saturday.
Ukraine said Russia shelled the village of Kupiansk-Vuzlovyi, a railway hub in the Kharkiv region near the border, wounding five, the regional prosecutor's office said.
